Wi-Fi AP Authentication

Theory

Electromagnetic Waves

Electromagnetic waves do not need a medium to propagate and in vacuum travel at the speed of light (299,792,458 m/s or 1,079,252,848.8 km/h).
Frequency formula. The smaller the wavelength (distance) - the higher the frequency (speed).
The greater the wave amplitude - the stronger the signal. 3 dBm change - power doubling (2x). 10 dBm change - power decupling (10x).

Wi-Fi Channels

Wi-Fi channel allocation across 2.4 GHz frequency spectrum used in 802.11b/g/n/ax standards.
Wi-Fi channel allocation across 5 GHz frequency spectrum used in 802.11a/n/ac/ax standards.

Wi-Fi WNIC Operation Modes

Wi-Fi service sets.
  • Master - AP.
  • Managed - client/station/supplicant.
  • Monitor - RFMON.

Wi-Fi Frame types

  1. Management frames: managing BSS (probing, associating, roaming, disconnecting).
    • Beacon - passive scanning.
    • Probe request/response - active scanning.
    • Association request/response - request to join BSS.
    • Reassociation request/response - used in roaming.
    • Disassociation.
    • Authentication.
    • Deauthentication.
    • Action.
  2. Control frames:
    • RTS - request to send.
    • CTS - clear to send.
    • ACK - acknowledgement.
    • Block ACK
    • Block ACK Request.
    • PS Poll.
  3. Data frames:
    • Data.
    • QoS Data.

https://howiwifi.com/2020/07/13/802-11-frame-types-and-formats/
